message:
Hello Guys, 
Is anyone here using some kinda remote developing machine?
I had my own setup as an instance on AWS and just connect to it through sublime SFTP, then I moved to Atom and nuclide but both ways have their own troubles.

I'm just wondering if anyone has a better practice?

data.message:
طيب و ليه متستخدمش vim علي نفس السيرفر و خلاص مثلا ؟
او حاجة زي cloud9 تعملها install علي السيرفر نفسه مثلا برضو ؟

مثلا : http://codiad.com/
There's thie remote feature in intellij products (pycharm, rubymine, etc)

there's also such solutions where you work locally and the files move synched automatically
https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-use-rsync-to-sync-local-and-remote-directories-on-a-vps
I understand you want to develop on the remote machine and access it remotely like a remote desktop, if so give this a try: https://www.nomachine.com/download
على حد معرفتي: لو السيرفر ويندوز استخدم Remote Desktop
Why do you want to develop remotely?
